channel.title: Darin Epsilon presents PERSPECTIVES - Progressive/Tech/Deep House
channel.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
channel.description: Internationally renowned DJ & producer Darin Epsilon is host of PERSPECTIVES, a monthly radio show and podcast that features the latest and greatest in Progressive House, Tech House, and Deep House music. Download guest mixes from top artists such as Darren Emerson, Robert Babicz, Guy J, Jody Wisternoff, Marc Marzenit, Moonbeam, Max Graham, Eelke Kleijn, Cid Inc, D:Fuse, and many more. To view tracklists or download talk-free versions of each episode, visit http://www.soundcloud.com/darinepsilon
channel.itunes:subtitle: Internationally renowned DJ and producer Darin Epsilon is host of PERSPECTIVES, a monthly podcast and radio show that features the latest and greatest in Progressive House, Tech House, and Deep House music.

item.title: Episode 063 - Part 1 - Darin Epsilon
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: It's been a busy last few weeks! I recently toured the UK and met some avid followers of the show face to face. Many thanks to everyone who helped make my first-ever trip to the UK so memorable. Our featured artists this month are T-Lectual and Summer from St. Louis. They have been turning heads with their recent work on Tulipa and Mirabilis Records, plus continual support from John Digweed and Hernan Cattaneo. It's safe to say that they're making the US midwest proud.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visit http://www.darinepsilon.com for more info

item.title: Episode 062 - Part 1 - Darin Epsilon
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: This episode of Perspectives is a very special one. The recording was taken from my recent show in Juarez, Mexico. The crowd was excellent and it was just a great night overall. Afterwards, make sure to check out the second half of the show, which features PD label artist Ian O'Donovan's live from AmplifyDestroy in London.

item.title: Episode 061 - Part 1 - Darin Epsilon
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Darren Emerson is considered one of the most influential figures in dance music, selling millions of albums and singles over a 17 year career. When he turned 18, he was invited to become the third member of Underworld, and the rest they say, is history. Needless to say, we're extremely honored to have the legendary DJ and producer provide a guest mix for our special WMC 2012 Edition of Perspectives.

item.title: Episode 060 - Part 1 - Darin Epsilon
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Our next guest is Silinder, one of the fastest rising stars out of Ireland. His remixes for New Order' James Zabiela' Spooky' and Hernan Cattaneo's label Sudbeat firmly placed him on the map' and he could now be considered one of the scene's most in-demand remixers. If that weren't enough' last summer he was named one of the Finalists in the Guy J remix contest for Bedrock. He has done some amazing work for my label Perspectives Digital (check out 'Drama Tank' and his remix of Michael Burns)' so I'm extremely excited to welcome him to the program for the very first time.

item.title: Episode 059 - Part 1 - Darin Epsilon
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Our featured guest for this episode of Perspectives is none other than Marc Marzenit from Spain. Hailed as one of the stars of the new generation, Marc is signed to some of the industry's most respected labels such as Bedrock, Sudbeat, and Cocoon. He's also famous for his Suite On Clouds live act that encompasses a unique fusion of classical and electronic sounds.

item.title: Episode 058 - Darin Epsilon - Live @ Avalon w/ Hernan Cattaneo and Nick Warren
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: The last Perspectives of 2011 features my opening set for Hernan Cattaneo and Nick Warren at LA's top nightclub, Avalon Hollywood. This was recorded live on December 17 using Pioneer CDJ2000 CD players and DJM900 mixer. Of course, nothing actually beats being there with the state-of-the-art lighting and sound systems, but hopefully this will help make you feel like you were right there on the dancefloor.

item.title: Episode 057 - Part 1 - Darin Epsilon
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Perspectives turns 5 years old this month! To celebrate this momentous occasion, we invited someone really special to provide the guest mix. That someone is Robert Babicz, a modern pioneer of electronic dance whose musical output is both inspiring and staggering. Producing hundreds of tracks under his own self-proclaimed Babiczstyle, it came as no surprise when Robert was invited to perform on BBC Radio 1's Essential Mix with Pete Tong earlier this year.

item.title: Episode 056 - Part 1 - Darin Epsilon
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Hour one features brand new music by Robert Babicz, Tom Middleton, Dousk, Kasey Taylor, Kassey Voorn, and more. In hour two we feature Denis A, the man behind the massive DAR Sessions in Moscow, using only tracks from his DAR record label. His signature tough and dark progressive house interweaved with rhythmic techno has received accolades from John Digweed, Sasha, Hernan Cattaneo, and Nick Warren.

item.title: Episode 055 - Part 1 - Darin Epsilon
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Making his debut on the program is highly gifted Dutch producer, Roger Martinez, one of your most requested artists on Perspectives. His exclusive 60 minute guest set leans heavily towards a Techno sound, although as he says, he prefers to keep his "musical crosshairs aimed at the full musical spectrum." 2011 saw the emergence of RogerMartinezLIVE, which consists of 100% Roger Martinez tracks. It comes as no surprise then that he was asked to join the prestigious GEM Bookings roster with his dynamic live show and impressive body of work.

item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Making his debut to the program is Perspectives Digital label artist Peter Golyan aka Lank. He is one of the most talented and sought-after Hungarian producers and DJs from the new generation. With his exceptional talent and consistently mind-blowing productions, I'm sure we'll be hearing his name more and more down the road.

item.title: Episode 053 - Part 2 - Eelke Kleijn - Live @ F Club in Slovenia
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: It's hard to believe the last time we had Eelke Kleijn on Perspectives was back in March 2007 for Episode 005! Over the past several months, I have received an overwhelming amount of requests from you to feature him on the show. So here he is... your most requested artist recorded live from his recent gig at F Club in Slovenia! Also featured in this episode is a 60 minute snippet of my opening set for James Zabiela at LA's top nightclub, Avalon.

item.title: Episode 052 - Part 2 - Nick Stoynoff
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Our next featured artist on Perspectives is a young and talented up-and-comer from my hometown of Chicago. Nick Stoynoff has been quickly building a name for himself with quality releases on Black Hole, Armada, Solaris, Proton Music, and Baroque Records. Recently, he was invited to play a warmup set for Hernan Cattaneo at Chicago's top venue, Vision Nightclub. At the moment, Nick is piecing together a live act that will feature reworks of previous tracks, new remixes, and unreleased material. He is also set to launch his podcast in June 2011, so be on the lookout for that.

item.title: Episode 051 - Part 2 - Guy J
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: If you've been following the show, you know that we've had some big guests on the show. Few, however, can say they're bigger than Guy J right at this moment. Make sure to check out the last five minutes of part one for Darin's exclusive one-on-one interview with Guy. The Israelian producer sits down to talk with us about his latest album 1000 Words, out now on Bedrock Records.

item.title: Episode 050 - Part 2 - Kenneth Thomas
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Spring is in the air and you know what that means. Thousands upon thousands of party-goers from all over the world descend upon Miami for one week of networking and hedonistic partying. This is one of the most important times of year for the dance music industry, so naturally it feels appropriate to dedicate this month's program to Miami Music Week. Our featured guest for the 50th episode of Perspectives is Kenneth Thomas, the official warmup DJ for many of Paul Oakenfold's world tours and artist on Perfecto, Armada, and Hope Recordings, among many others. In his own words, KT describes this mix as a slightly darker, moodier mix, exclusively made for Perspectives Episode 050.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visit http://www.darinepsilon.com for more info

item.title: Episode 049 - Part 2 - Wes Straub
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Every now and then, we here at Perspectives like to give credit to the movers and shakers in the progressive scene. This month's guest mix comes courtesy of Wes Straub from Calgary, Canada. For those of you who aren't in the know, Wes is one of Western Canada's brightest talents both as a DJ and producer. Locally, he has had the privilege of playing many of Calgary's biggest club shows, sharing the booth with the likes of Markus Schulz, Sander van Doorn, Nick Warren, Jody Wisternoff, Max Graham, and Infected Mushroom.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visit http://www.darinepsilon.com for more info

item.title: Episode 048 - Part 2 - Satoshi Fumi
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: For our 48th episode of Perspectives, we have invited one of Japan's most respected names in deep tech house. With an average 3-4 releases per month, it's fair to say Satoshi Fumi's life is quite dedicated to his art. Some of his career highlights include remixing Above & Beyond and signing with top labels Anjunabeats, Bedrock, Yoshitoshi, and Urban Torque. If you haven't already, be sure to check out Satoshi's excellent remix of Darin Epsilon & Paronator 'Esperanto' on Perspectives Digital.

item.title: Episode 047 - Part 2 - D:Fuse - 4th Year Anniversary
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: D:Fuse caused quite a stir following his first guest appearance on Episode 028 back in March 2009. Since then, we couldn't wait to get him back on the show! There are DJs who turn up and play tracks, and then there are DJs that redefine what a DJ does. That person is D:Fuse; a producer, drummer, and vocalist who has taken DJing and moved it into a new arena where live instrumentation, infectious energy and flawless music selection seats him in a classification all his own. This dynamic combination has earned D:Fuse a slot in the top 35 DJs in America 3 years running (DJ Times Magazine). Enjoy his brand new set that was specially prepared for our 4th year anniversary broadcast.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visit http://www.darinepsilon.com for more info

item.title: Episode 046 - Part 2 - Cid Inc
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Perspectives Digital has officially launched! Naturally, we thought it would be a great idea to invite the supremely talented Cid Inc, who just completed a remix for the label's first release, onto the program. Cid celebrated the end of last year with well-deserved recognition for his production skills. Beatport officially selected him as one of their Progressive House Artists of 2009, further cementing his reputation as an elite DJ and producer in the global electronic dance scene. Fusing progressive and tech house with elements from other styles, the Cid Inc sound is a thoroughly modern and exciting interpretation of the house blueprint.

item.title: Episode 044 - Part 1 - Jason LeMaitre
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Back for his second appearance on Perspectives is DJ4Life instructor Jason LeMaitre from Seattle. 2010 has been a big year for Jason. Already he has seen his unique blend of prog/tech house recruited to support such household names such as Paul Van Dyk, John Digweed, and The Black Eyed Peas. In addition to this, he just celebrated the 4th year anniversary of his residency at Trinity Nightclub in Seattle, which has grown to become one of the city's most successful weekly events. In hour two, Darin Epsilon brings debuts new music from Robert Babicz, Henry Saiz, Derek Howell, Kasey Taylor, Michael Burns presents Blue Haze, and more.

item.title: Episode 043 - Part 1 - Sezer Uysal
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Our next guest on Perspectives is one of the fastest rising DJs and producers in the progressive dance scene today. Hailing from Bursa, Turkey, Sezer Uysal has received a whirlwind of support in a relatively short span of time. His talent is genuine and you can find Sezer's music on prestigious labels such as Baroque and Outside The Box Music. With throbbing bass lines and blissful melodies, complemented by that glitched-out proggy edge, waves of people see themselves moving to the sounds generated from this energetic youngster. In hour two, Darin brings you new music from Jimmy Van M, Luis Junior, Pig and Dan, and Quivver. Don't miss a second of today's show!

item.title: Episode 043 - Part 2 - Darin Epsilon
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Our next guest on Perspectives is one of the fastest rising DJs and producers in the progressive dance scene today. Hailing from Bursa, Turkey, Sezer Uysal has received a whirlwind of support in a relatively short span of time. His talent is genuine and you can find Sezer's music on prestigious labels such as Baroque and Outside The Box Music. With throbbing bass lines and blissful melodies, complemented by that glitched-out proggy edge, waves of people see themselves moving to the sounds generated from this energetic youngster. In hour two, Darin brings you new music from Jimmy Van M, Luis Junior, Pig and Dan, and Quivver. Don't miss a second of today's show!
item.itunes:subtitle: Visit http://www.darinepsilon.com for more info

item.title: Episode 042 - Part 1 - Chris Stock - World Cup Edition
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: As all eyes turn towards South Africa for the 2010 World Cup, we felt it would be appropriate to showcase somebody who is really driving the scene forward in that part of the world. Our guest this month, Chris Stock, comes from its largest city of Johannesburg. He is one of the most successful DJs in the area and considered a leader in the South African progressive and tech house scene. Chris says his music cannot be described as one particular sound or direction and is not restricted to one genre; instead there are elements of many, drifting seamlessly in a contemporary cosmopolitan mashup of progressive house, blistering tech and minimal agendas. In hour two, Darin Epsilon presents his opening set for Hernan Cattaneo at Avalon in Los Angeles.

item.title: Episode 041 - Part 1 - Trafik
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Celebrating their brand new album on Global Underground this month is the UK duo known Trafik, also known as Andrew Archer and John Elliott. 'None But The Brave' is their first album in 3 years and is a return to more eclectic feel of their first album 'Bullet' back in 2004, and according to the boys themselves it is 'easily our best work yet.' For the first hour, Perspectives will be airing the live recording from Trafik's recent performance at Chocolate Club in Dubai. Then stay tuned for hour two as Darin Epsilon showcases new music by Matthias Vogt, Joris Voorn, Eelke Kleijn, Underworld, Oliver Smith, and more.

item.title: Episode 040 - Part 1 - Azok and Souldier
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Perspectives is proud to present two DJs from Mexico City who are really making an impact in their local scene. Azok and Souldier play a wide range of music that crosses between house, deep house, tech house, and progressive house. Their passion for the music and unique track selection has gotten them invited to spin at many of the most important clubs in Mexico, alongside several international DJs. In hour two, Darin Epsilon showcases several of his favorite tunes from the past month and a brand new remix of his latest single Cold Water (with Ad Brown) due in stores May 18 on Silk Royal Records.

item.title: Episode 039 - Part 1 - DJ Tarkan
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Turkish superstar DJ Tarkan is back for the special WMC 2010 edition of Perspectives, hosted by Darin Epsilon. Named as one of the DJ Mag Top 100 DJs in 2006, a 3-time winner of the award for Number One DJ in Turkey, founder of No Smoking Recordings, and even featured on MTV, Tarkan is without a doubt one of the most recognized and driving forces in progressive music today. In hour two, Darin Epsilon introduces new music from 16 Bit Lolitas, Patch Park, Oliver Moldan, Cid Inc, and many more.

item.title: Episode 038 - Part 1 - Dezarate
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Perspectives returns with an exclusive guest set from one of the world's hardest working DJs and producers. Born in Barcelona, Spain, Dezarate describes his own music as "elegant music for elegant people". His tracks can be found on big-name compilations from Paul Oakenfold, Ministry of Sound, Cafe del Mar, and Buddha Bar. Having begun his career in music as far back as 1997, Dezarate has played at several top clubs throughout Spain, Ibiza, and Mexico, and recently been invited to play under the banner of Godskitchen for the BoomBox tour in Mexico City. After the guest mix, stick around for hour two as Darin Epsilon brings you a live recording of his recent set from Monday Night Social @ Playhouse Hollywood.

item.title: Episode 037 - Part 1 - Moonbeam
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Perspectives welcomes the two extraordinarily talented brothers known as Moonbeam to the program this month. It's difficult not to feel lazy when reflecting on their endless list of accomplishments. Between running their own digital label to maintaining a hectic tour schedule (including playing with Tiesto in Kiev for over 14,000 people) to hosting two radio shows to directing their own music videos, the brothers somehow manage to keep it all together. Their hard work has certainly not been overlooked. In 2009 Moonbeam took 76th position in the DJ Mag Top 100 DJs. After the exclusive Moonbeam guest set, stay tuned for hour 2 as Darin Epsilon introduces new music from Jim Rivers, DJ Remy, EDX, Lutzenkirchen, Lank, Guy J, and more.

item.title: Episode 036 - Part 1 - Inkfish
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: The last Perspectives episode of 2009 features a brand new exclusive guest mix by Inkfish. Originally formed in 1998 with four members, the group as of 2009 are two brothers, Andreas and Johan Hermansson. Together, they have had over 70 releases and reached the top of the Beatport sales charts numerous times. Their reputation as quality DJs and producers has allowed them to travel to over 30 countries. In hour two, Darin Epsilon presents the live recording from his recent show at top club Vanguard in Los Angeles.

item.title: Episode 035 - Part 1 - Jody Wisternoff
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Perspectives celebrates its 3rd year anniversary with an exclusive guest set by Jody Wisternoff! The man needs no introduction. Jody's influence can be felt all around the progressive house community, both as an in-demand solo artist and as Way Out West (with Nick Warren). Whether he is topping the charts or rocking the best clubs around the world, you can be sure to expect nothing but quality music. Tune in to hear brand new music by Ian Pooley, Ben Watt, Bent, Guy J, Tom Middleton, Depeche Mode, and many more.

item.title: Episode 034 - Part 1 - Chloe Harris
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Perspectives proudly welcomes back one of our most popular guests from the past year. Chloe Harris is back for round two, and she promises to have a few new tricks up her sleeves. Having been named John Digweed's Breakthrough DJ of 2007 in the annual DJ Mag Top 100 poll, Chloe manages to be one of the rare individuals that lives up to the hype. She has proven herself time and time again, as both a prolific DJ and producer. Her career continues to fluorish with the introduction of her new label, Further. Expect a wide range of quality releases from Chloe's imprint in the coming months.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visit http://www.darinepsilon.com for more info

item.title: Episode 033 - Part 1 - RioTGeaR
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Special three hour show featuring well known DJs in the Miami dance scene. RioTGeaR is a duo comprised of Andy Pate and Bobby Bassett. As DJs, their sets range in style from chunky tech house to pumping progressive. This dynamic sound has helped them achieve opening slots for Tiesto and Deadmau5 on their upcoming world tours, as well as guest spots at some of Miami's top venues including Space, Nikki Beach, Ultra Music Festival, and Gryphon. Jose Mata has emerged as a fresh, young talent who continues to mesmerized faithful audiences with his soul-stirring progressive house and progressive trance. No matter if it's the beaches of Miami or in the clubs in Los Angeles, the dance floor remains packed and well accepted of what comes from this young and trend setting DJ and artist.

item.title: Episode 032 - Part 1 - Darren Drake
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: The next featured artist comes from the town of Derry in Ireland. Perspectives has featured the music of several producers from the Emerald Isle in the past, but never before have we featured a DJ from the area. Darren hosts Audio Therapy's radio show 'Therapy Sessions' along with his brother Adrian Drake. Together, they are collectively known as The Therapists. Expect a solid blend of various styles masterfully blended by one of the country's finest. Then stick around for hour two as Darin Epsilon presents new tracks by Simon and Shaker, Way Out West, Luke Chable, Shiloh, Sultan and Ned Shepard, and more!
item.itunes:subtitle: Visit http://www.darinepsilon.com for more info

item.title: Episode 030 - Part 1 - Thomas Penton
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Making his Perspectives debut is Thomas Penton from Miami. Expect two hours of packed energy as he brings his signature blend of peak-time progressive and tech house to the airwaves. Having started his career in 1992, Thomas has built a solid reputation and proven to be one of the scene's strongest producers time and time again. Darin Epsilon is proud to present a true scene legend to the program, you don't want to miss this show!

item.title: Episode 025 - Part 1 - Jason LeMaitre
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Trinity Nightclub and Qool Seattle resident Jason LeMaitre is the guest for this 25th edition of PERSPECTIVES. Far from being just another DJ, Jason is first and foremost an accomplished purveyor of exceptionally good times. Jason has successfully combined his two greatest passions - a love for music and a desire to please - with his instinctive ability to throw unforgettable parties. The result has been Jason's well deserved ascendancy to a position of DJ prominence in the Seattle music scene over the past three years. Together with PERSPECTIVES host, Darin Epsilon, prepare for 2 hours of the absolute best in Progressive House, Tech House, Techno, and Deep House.

Far from being just another DJ, Jason is first and foremost an accomplished purveyor of exceptionally good times. Jason has successfully combined his two greatest passions - a love for music and a desire to please - with his instinctive ability to throw unforgettable parties. The result has been Jason's well deserved ascendancy to a position of DJ prominence in the Seattle music scene over the past three years. Together with PERSPECTIVES host, Darin Epsilon, prepare for 2 hours of the absolute best in Progressive House, Tech House, Techno, and Deep House.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visit http://www.darinepsilon.com for more info

item.title: Episode 024 - Part 1 - Max Graham
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: The two year anniversary of PERSPECTIVES is finally here! In celebration of this momentous occasion, internationally recognized DJ and producer Max Graham has put together a brand new set for the show. As one of the most respected DJs in the scene today, Max Graham needs no introduction. Having just released his latest compilation 'Cycles' and touring the world over, as well as running his label re*brand, Max is easily one of the busiest DJs on the circuit. His amazing track selection and stellar production skills have won him numerous fans and given him the opportunity to work with the industry's most established names.

item.title: Episode 021 - Part 1 - Chloe Harris
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: The next guest on PERSPECTIVES needs no introduction. Over the past several years, Chloe Harris has earned a reputation as being one of the hardest-working and most respected progressive DJs on the planet. Now under her new production alias Raica, Chloe's signature sound will continue to raise eyebrows around the world. Join your host Darin Epsilon as he presents a brand new set from the one and only Chloe Harris!

item.title: Episode 020 - Part 1 - Mashtronic
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: It's been far too long since Mashtronic has made their way back onto PERSPECTIVES! If you remember back in November 2006, Matthias Bradler and Cid Inc (also known as Mashtronic), were the first guests ever to be invited onto the program. Nearly two years later, the dynamic duo still have plenty of tricks up their sleeves. Now focusing on their individual solo careers, they each remain at the forefront of the progressive scene. This July, Darin Epsilon proudly welcomes back... Mashtronic!

item.title: Episode 019 - Part 1 - Logiztik Sounds
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: As one of the hardest working DJs in the industry, chances are you have come across Logiztik Sounds' name before. As the official winner of the Sasha Beatport remix contest, his productions have become synonymous with quality and professionalism. He has signed more than 60 singles and remixed for more than 40 different labels, including Global Underground and Baroque. This proves that he is one the new rising stars from South America. Join host Darin Epsilon as he presents this bright young talent from Montevideo, Uruguay.

item.title: Episode 018 - Part 1 - Fine Taste
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: The Dutch are known for many things: windmills, wooden shoes, gabber music, and Fine Taste. Fine Taste is better known as Johan Vermeulen (Interplay) and Freek Geuze (Smartminds), two young but highly talented DJs/producers set for superstardom. As two of the most in-demand producers of the moment, their signature style can generally be defined as strong, powerful, melodic, and groovey house music. Nearly every top jock from around the world has included a Fine Taste production in his or her playlist, and no less than Sander Kleinenberg has instantly recognized their talent. Darin Epsilon invites you to tune in for yet another smashing episode of PERSPECTIVES.

item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Episode 017 of PERSPECTIVES marks the triumphant return of Matt Rowan! His first appearance is still one of the most talked-about and and downloaded sets to date. Get ready for the Aussie wonder from down under to invade an airwave near you! Don't miss all the fun, tune into Perspectives for two hours of sizzling-hot Progressive House to keep the kangaroos hopping for more.

item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: This month's featured artist on PERSPECTIVES needs no introduction. For over a decade, Kenneth Thomas has worked incredibly hard to become one of the most recognized DJs in the world. Perfecto legend Paul Oakenfold named Kenneth as his next big hope in the DJ Mag Top 100 DJs Poll. With an impressive resume of world tours and production credits under his belt, Kenneth is bound for even more success in the near future.

item.title: Episode 015 - Part 1 - Andre Solaris
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: For the 15th episode of PERSPECTIVES, Darin Epsilon has invited back former XM Radio star Andre Solaris for a second appearance on the show. With his impeccable track selection and mixing skills, Andre has managed to become a household name in the Chicagoland area. He has hosted several high-profile radio shows throughout his career, both nationally (XM Satellite, Sirius Radio) and locally (Q101 Sonic Boom, Energy 92.7 FM), and has been responsible for some of the most memorable parties in Chicago nightlife history.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visit http://www.darinepsilon.com for more info

item.title: Episode 009 - Part 1 - Vinny Troia
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Stemming from a lifetime of devotion in music, Vinny Troia has pushed his way forward in the dance and electronic community. He has created remixes for artists such as Ultra Nate, N'Dea Davenport, Lovesky and Jody Watley, all of which have appeared in the Billboard Dance chart. As the founder and A&R of Curvve Recordings, Vinny has lead Curvve towards becoming one of the current top selling dance labels on the market (according to Beatport.com and Ingrooves sales statistics). His astronishing career continues to rise, with no signs of slowing down.

item.title: Episode 003 - Part 1 - Matt Rowan
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: Aussie wonder from down under Matt Rowan is the featured artist for this third installment of PERSPECTIVES. He is a DJ and producer that needs little introduction, as he's been getting plays from virtually every top Progressive DJ in the world. Matt has been moving quickly in the past few years, with releases on Nick Warren's Hope Recordings and an appearance with producing partner Jaytech on Dave Seaman's Renaissance CD compilation. The second half of the show will feature Darin Epsilon's current favorites and his top selections from recent gigs.

item.title: Episode 001 - Part 1 - Mashtronic
item.itunes:author: Darin Epsilon
item.description: This month Darin Epsilon is proud to present Mashtronic, also known as Mathias Bradler and Henri Hurtig. Mashtronic is one of the biggest up-and-coming names in the Progressive scene. Their signature sound has landed them at the top of every DJ's charts and captivated audiences all over the world. With dozens of remixes and original productions under their belts and collaborations with such artists as John Digweed, Pole Folder, Can Costa, and Phatjak, Mashtronic is definitely headed on the path to stardom.
